DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Submission Patient Ancillary Study Two Eligibility Determination Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of MRI submission period for a patient/participant registered to an ancillary clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Submission Patient Ancillary Study Two Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to whether eligibility criteria have been met for the patient to participate in the second (a natural number greater than 1 and less than 3) ancillary (companion study; studies which are secondary to another study) clinical study, including the submission (referred for judgment or consideration) of MRIs (imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies which are secondary to another study.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of eligibility determination for a patient/participant registered to an ancillary clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.: Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.definition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
